SENT.plain: A man complaining of blurred vision had diffuse retinal capillary telangiectasia as a primary retinal finding
Evaluation of the carotid arteries by a noninvasive angiographic method revealed bilateral, silent occlusions of both common carotid arteries
Thus, some cases of "idiopathic retinal capillary telangiectasia" may in fact be harbingers of underlying carotid artery disease
